160.description: The course will study Italian culture from the perspective of social and historical forces, as articulated by a broad variety of cultural, ideological, and institutional discourses.
160.title: Studies in the History, Society, and Politics of the Italian Peninsula

299.description: Limited to students engaged in research for the doctoral dissertation.
299.title: Directed Research

1S.description: An intensive Italian language course designed for native or advanced speakers of Spanish. In one semester, we will cover materials usually taught in two semesters in Elementary Italian 1 and 2. Students who successfully complete the course will be able to enroll in Italian 3 (Intermediate Italian). Regular and continued attendance of both classes is mandatory.
1S.title: Intensive Italian for Spanish Speakers

1.description: Basic grammar for beginners: Part one.
1.title: Elementary Italian

282.description: Directed reading course leading to the production of a formal dissertation prospectus with detailed bibliography. Course is required for all Doctor of Philosophy candidates.
282.title: Prospectus Tutorial

120.description: Three hours of lectures, readings, and discussion per week on major authors, themes, and movements in Italian literature.
120.title: Topics in Italian Studies

110.description: Emphasis on the literature and culture of the 13th and 14th centuries. Literature will emphasize the "Stil Novo" and Dante's minor works as well as Boccaccio's <Decameron> and Petrarch's <Rime>.
110.title: Literature and Culture of the 13th and 14th Centuries

270.description: Directed research leading to the writing of a term paper under the direction of an Italian Studies department faculty member. Requires concurrent enrollment in a 100-series seminar.
270.title: Seminar Research Course

3.description: Grammar review, reading, and written composition.
3.title: Intermediate Italian

2.description: Basic grammar for beginners: Part two.
2.title: Elementary Italian

290A.description: Reports on current scholarly work by faculty and graduate students.
290A.title: Graduate Colloquium in Italian Studies

101A.description: Reading and grammatical analysis of representative texts; advanced written composition.
101A.title: Advanced Grammar, Reading, and Composition

260.description: Directed readings undertaken under the direction of a faculty member of the department of Italian Studies in conjunction with an audit of a 100-series seminar.
260.title: Directed Readings in Italian Literature and Culture

R5A.description: Reading and composition course based on works by Italians and foreigners about Italy and its culture and by Italians about their distinctive experiences of other cultures as tourists and emigrants. Works studied will be primarily chosen from among fiction and non fiction narratives, both originally in English and translated into it. R5A satisfies the first half of the Reading and Composition Requirement and R5B satisfies the second half.
R5A.title: Reading and Composition

R5B.description: Reading and composition course based on works by Italians and foreigners about Italy and its culture and by Italians about their distinctive experiences of other cultures as tourists and emigrants. Works studied will be primarily chosen from among fiction and non fiction narratives, both originally in English and translated into it. R5A satisfies the first half of the Reading and Composition Requirement and R5B satisfies the second half.
R5B.title: Reading and Composition

98.description: Group study of selected topics not covered by regularly scheduled courses.
98.title: Directed Group Study

244.description: Investigation of significant genres and modes of writing as they recur in the course of Italian cultural history.
244.title: Special Topics in Genre and Mode

170.description: An analysis of Italian cinema as seen in the development of specific film genres such as neorealism, comedy, self-reflexive cinema. Occasionally the course will concentrate on a specific director and study his individuality through style, theme, and personal development. This course fulfills film major requirement in one of history, genre, auteur.
170.title: The Italian Cinema: History, Genres, Authors

104.description: Introduction to basic works of Italian literature (fiction, poetry, drama) with an emphasis on techniques of reading.
104.title: Reading Italian Literature

198.description: Supervised group study of selected topics not covered by regularly scheduled courses.
198.title: Directed Group Study

24.description: The Berkeley Seminar Program has been designed to provide new students with the opportunity to explore an intellectual topic with a faculty member in a small-seminar setting. Berkeley Seminars are offered in all campus departments, and topics vary from department to department and semester to semester.
24.title: Freshman Seminars

197.description: Supervised field programs involving experiences in schools and school-related activities. Weekly participation commitment, regular individual meetings with faculty supervisor and written reports required.
197.title: Field Studies

97.description: Supervised field programs involving experiences in schools and school-related activities. Weekly participation commitment, regular individual meetings with faculty supervisor and written reports required.
97.title: Field Studies

215.description: Investigation of major topics, genres, and authors in Italian literature and culture of the 15th and 16th centuries.
215.title: Seminar in Renaissance Literature and Culture

302.title: Practicum in College Teaching of Italian

303.description: Three hours of classroom teaching per week with regular faculty supervision; attendance at faculty lectures where appropriate; routine meetings to discuss and evaluate teaching methods, including lecturing, discussion, classroom activities, grading and testing, design of syllabi and course materials.
303.title: Practicum in the Teaching of Italian Literature, History, and Culture

235.description: Investigation of major topics, genres, and authors in Italian literature and culture of the 20th century.
235.title: Seminar in 20th Century Literature and Culture

375.description: Required of all graduate student instructors in their first semester of teaching. This course provides instruction on the theory and practice of foreign language teaching and learning with lectures on methodology, testing, grading, class preparation, textbook selection and evaluation, course design and development, and the use of audio-visual and computer aids to instruction. A final research paper is required. It also includes supervised classroom practice.
375.title: Seminar in Language Pedagogy

4.description: Selected readings in modern Italian prose; a review of the essentials of grammar; written and oral compositions.
4.title: Intermediate Italian

199.description: Enrollment restrictions apply; see the Introduction to the Course and Curricula section of this catalog.
199.title: Supervised Independent Study and Research for Advanced Undergraduates

H195.description: Limited to senior honors candidates. Directed study relating to the writing of an honors thesis.
H195.title: Special Studies for Honors Candidates

40.description: Introduction to Italian studies through selected topics and themes integral to the history, literature, and arts of Italy from Dante to Fellini.
40.title: Italian Culture (in English)

298.description: Designed to allow students to do research in areas not covered by other courses. Requires regular discussions with the instructor and a final written report.
298.title: Special Study

50.description: Interdisciplinary introduction to the Italian Renaissance through selected topics integral to the history, literature, and arts of Italy in the fifteenth and sixteenth centuries.
50.title: The Italian Renaissance
